attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Rescind Donald Trump's state visit invitation.
attributes.background: After Donald Trump was invited to make a state visit to the UK he used a terrorist attack in London to make political capital and to undermine the Mayor of London's response to that attack. The UK government should make its displeasure clear by rescinding his state visit invitation.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been other examples of Donald Trump's actions since the invitation was issued that show he does not deserve this honour:

- He said that there were "many fine people" participating in a neo-nazi / white supremacist rally.
- He equated the actions of those at the rally with the people protesting it.
- He declared transgender people unfit to serve in armed forces in any capacity.

The UK government should demonstrate a break from these values by rescinding the state visit invitation.

attributes.action: Halve Tuition Fees, & bring back Maintenance Grants for all University students.
attributes.background: Universities are institutions of education, where students across the UK develop knowledge and skills. Yet, over recent years, the fees have been dramatically increased for reasons no Minister can explain. Each year, thousands of students fail to apply due to the cost. These fees must be reduced.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, if a UK student wishes to study at ANY university, for ANY course, they must pay £9,250 a YEAR, over their course length. Additionally, all students have a maintenance loan, which again, needs to be repaid. This eventually leaves many students with a debt of around £51,000 at the age of 21. This means that as soon as they enter work, that debt needs repaying. This petition would decrease student debt from around £51,000 over a lifetime to around £13,800, which is a vast improvement.

attributes.action: When we have any election include a selection for “None of the above”.
attributes.background:
This would allow me to register my vote as none of the candidates represent me in my constituency. 

This would also give the public a way to show no confidence in the current sitting representative as opposed to voting for a candidate that I do not believe in.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I can put forward is the large numbers that do not vote.

attributes.action: Make desecration of war memorials and symbols of remembrance a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
War memorials were constructed at the center of towns and villages so that people could be reminded of the sacrifices made by brave men and women who died to preserve our freedom.
Poppies and other items are placed at these memorials to ensure we do not forget those sacrifices.
attributes.additional_details:
There are now too many instances of people that think it is in order to desecrate these memorials, poppies and other items which are there to remind us of a debt owed to the many that gave their lives so that we could be free.
Desecrating of war memorials, items purchased and placed on these memorials are to be respected.
Whatever political, religious or ethnic issues people may have, their argument cannot be with the fallen heroes of another generation.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit return to old system!
attributes.background: New universal credit replaces JSA, income support, ESA, Housing benefit, Tax credits and working tax credits. Government says universal credit will make work pay. This is rubbish. Universal credit is about cutting the social security bill meaning millions will be worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Once fully implemented will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live on nothing. Housing subsidy will be time limited forcing more to be homeless. Support for childcare will be drastically cut. Disability element's cut or abolished altogether. Some rates are much lower than current benefit rates. Government has so far wasted hundreds of millions. They will save billions taking from the needy and most vulnerable in our society. This is a war against the poor. Whilst they prop up the rich!

attributes.action: Make self defence classes compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: With the rising rates of brutal and savage knife crimes, muggings and terror attacks in the UK, it is vital we begin educating the new generation on how to protect and defend themselves in panic situations.
attributes.additional_details:
An average of 65 people die from knife crime in the UK every year.
Pepper spray is banned in the UK, as are other self defence weapons. 
2017 has seen the biggest rise in terror attacks.

attributes.action: Create a devolved Yorkshire Assembly with powers equal to the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to create a devolved legislative and executive body representing the traditional county of Yorkshire which will have powers equal to that of the Welsh Assembly, overseeing local matters such as housing; the environment; health services and flood defences.

attributes.action: Use the Tampon Tax to subsidise sanitary products for girls of school age
attributes.background:
We believe the money gained through the tampon tax should be used for Period related issues.
Children of school age currently receive:
Free school meals
Free prescriptions
Free or subsided transport
Free contraception
We believe that sanitary wear should be added to this list.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39266056

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/girls-skipping-school-periods-cant-afford-tampons-sanitary-pads-a7629766.html

Periodicaldiary.com

attributes.action: The government should not be transferring all EU Regulations into British law.
attributes.background:
All EU law is bad law.  We do not want one single word of it in British law. The government is transferring 170,000 pages of EU Regulations and Directives into English law. 
It is all just EU Red Tape and it is strangling British industry. 
Say no to the Acquis Communautaire.

attributes.action: Repeal the Resale Prices Act to reflect & protect high street retailing in 2017
attributes.background: The simplistic view of the 1964 RRP Act does not consider the damage caused by 'pop up' internet retailers & is clearly not in the long term public interest (requirement of the Act). The CMA enforcement of this ruling is forcing retailers to close, removing our conduit to consumer education & jobs!
attributes.additional_details:
"The UK supply chain supports 1,700 companies across a diverse lighting sector and is worth £2.3bn to the economy. The UK is home to more than 140 lighting design practices that specify lighting for mainly overseas projects and which present a unique opportunity for lighting manufacturers to access global markets.” Michael Fallon MP.

Jobs are being lost across the sector, training has almost ceased because retailers cannot make a living; this ACT must be urgently reviewed to save the industry.

attributes.action: Ban 15 minute Home Care visits.Increase to minimum 30 minutes.
attributes.background: Majority of care companies advertise '15 MINUTE CALLS' like it's a good thing? This needs to change. I have witnessed rushed calls, unhappy clients and mistakes made all with these 15 minute calls. This is not enough time to make the individual feel comfortable. Let alone fill out their paperwork.
attributes.additional_details:
1. It is not enough time to make somebody feel comfortable in their own home
2. It is rushed
3. Half hour is much better and realistic
4. Carers are in such a rush during that call to get to the next call, leading them to be stressed, late to their next. Accident prone
5. Elderly especially find this confusing if they are living with Alzheimer's or Dementia.
6. Mistakes are made. There is no time to double check everything is complete and the individual is happy.

attributes.action: End the benefits freeze
attributes.background: The freeze of working age benefits will take almost £1 billion from the pockets of people living in Scotland by 2020/21. People across Scotland are affected by the freeze and by ending it we will improve both our society and the economy by putting money in people’s pockets.
attributes.additional_details:
Keeping the cash value of benefits the same while costs are rising is pushing people into poverty. The freeze on working age benefits will affect around 750,000 households by the end of the decade.
Reversing the freeze could help lift people out of poverty and prevent others from falling into poverty. Research from CPAG shows that reversing the freeze to even just the child element of tax credits and child benefit could keep up to 400,000 children across the UK from falling into poverty.

attributes.action: Update BE test rules to allow automatic cars to be used and gain manual as well
attributes.background: The BE driving licence rules need to be updated to allow people that take the test in an automatic to gain manual entitlement if they hold manual Cat B licence, as this is proving difficult for Trainers to buy suitable test vehicles, as more and more car manufacturers are stopping making manual cars
attributes.additional_details:
The rules were changed to allow Cat C and CE candidates to pass a test in an automatic truck and gain manual entitlement if they hold a manual Cat B licence, as more and more trucks were being made in automatic only.
This is now happening with car manufacturers and proving to be a problem to trainers in our industry.
Automatic vehicles are now more fuel efficient than manual vehicles so I feel the rules must be changed swiftly to enable us to help with reducing emissions to help our planet

attributes.action: Cancel plans to make banks check the immigration status of account holders
attributes.background: Starting in January 2018, UK banks will be required to carry out quarterly immigration checks on all account holders. Those found to be resident without permission will have their accounts frozen or closed down. This ramping up of the 'hostile environment' strategy will have disastrous consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Under the immigration act 2014, status checks are required for anyone opening a new bank account in the UK. A 2016 report by the chief inspector of borders and immigration uncovered a 10% error rate. The Home Office simply does not have the administrative capacity or competence to execute checks on 70m accounts without causing huge collateral damage. More fundamentally, attempts to decrease net migration by denying irregular migrants access to necessities are draconian and inhumane.

attributes.action: Ban cigarette smoking in public areas.
attributes.background: Most people will agree that inhaling the poison in cigarettes should be optional. Yet we still have to breathe it in when simply walking in public. If you don't want to breathe in the health damaging smoke of passers by then sign this petition to get a government ban on smoking in public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking and passive smoking has serious health risks. We should all be allowed to choose whether we want to be subjected to those risks.

attributes.action: Legislate to vaccinate all cows against TB and stop culling Badgers.
attributes.background: The Government is proposing to allow further Badger culls in an attempt to eradicate TB in cows. It is cruel and doesn't work as previous trials have shown. The should legislate to immunise cows by vaccinating them against TB instead and stop proposing to kill Badgers

attributes.action: To make every person who works driving HGV in this country pass a UK HGV test
attributes.background: This will make sure that the industry's standards are the same throughout  and drivers have a good sound knowledge of UK Driving rules and regulations before they can be employed as an HGV driver in the UK.

attributes.action: Scrap the variable speed limits as a traffic calming measure on the M25
attributes.background: I feel the variable speed limits cause unnecessary traffic on the motorway, cause accidents and add extra stress to daily driving on the motorway, I understand when there is an accident or incident on the motorway it is necessary  but used as a 'traffic calming' measure' doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: 90% of the time driving on the m25 there is a 60mph 50 and 40 limit imposed where drives slow down under the gantry to around 30mph which causes drivers to brake and further down turns into stand still, once national speed limit is in place the traffic is clear. this is guaranteed in the same places, almost every day in peak hours.

attributes.action: Guarantee equal or better funding for scientific research in the UK after Brexit
attributes.background: We rely heavily on EU research funding ~€1.2 billion p.a. from Horizon 2020, there is no clear plan on how this will be replaced after Brexit. I ask that the future funding is guaranteed and extra UK grants are made that at least match or better the input from Horizon 2020 to UK HE institutions.
attributes.additional_details:
At time of writing, there is no deal for joint EU-UK research funding after Brexit. The UK will not have access to the same amount of funding and hundreds of top level research jobs will be lost due to the shortfall, unless the UK government increases domestic research budgets. https://ec.europa.eu/unitedkingdom/news/uk-institutions-and-researchers-top-recipients-eu-innovation-funding_en

UK HE institutes received ~€1.2 billion in 2015 http://ec.europa.eu/budget/figures/interactive/index_en.cfm

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory from the age of 18
attributes.background: The turnouts for general elections are extremely low. On average only 60% of registered voters actually take part. The remaining 40% remain passive despite the fact that they're UK citizens and the outcome greatly affects not only them, but their family and friends.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2010 general elections the total UK citizens that voted amounted to just 65% . This shows that a significant amount of potential voters did not take part. The remaining 16 million registered could've hugely impacted the end result if they'd only bothered to vote.

attributes.action: Re-nationalise the train service
attributes.background: Due to the privatisation of the train services, commuters have experienced frequent delays, with poorer service than would be expected of any EU country's services. On top of this, commuters face high fares, which are rising much faster than the rate of inflation.
attributes.additional_details: If we take Berlin and London, we can see a stark contrast in travel card prices there. For example, a day travel card in Berlin (zones ABC - which includes the city and its surrounding area) would cost an adult 7,70€ (£6.78), however, in London a day travel card (in zones 1-6) would cost an adult £11.70. The difference shows that a nationalised system is cheaper.

attributes.action: Explain why the 2016 EU referendum was called with only four months' notice
attributes.background: The decision on staying in or leaving the EU is a major constitutional issue and could have far-reaching consequences. We believe that four months (February to June 2016) was not long enough for voters to consider carefully all the issues involved before making a properly informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: Since the vote, many issues regarding the consequences of Brexit have emerged that were hardly discussed during the referendum campaign. The date of the 2014 Scottish independence referendum was announced two years in advance, as this was deemed to be a major constitutional matter which would require this length of time for voters to make their decision. We believe that the date of the EU referendum should have been announced at least a year in advance.

attributes.action: All residents of the United Kingdom to be issued with a Biometric Identity Card.
attributes.background: The introduction of Biometric Identity Cards would reduce time and costs to Government agencies in checking legal residents and citizens’ status, make ID checks by Police, Immigration and other official bodies impartial and puts every entitled resident/citizen on a level playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently several ID card schemes in the UK including; Proof of age card, 'Gov.UK Verify', (described as an 'Online ID card), Passports and driving licenses, but not everyone has one and all of these are voluntary and not all are Biometric.
A National Biometric ID card would streamline the system, reduce costs and protect the law abiding legal residents and citizens in the UK whilst at the same time making life more difficult for those that choose to defraud or harm us.

attributes.action:
Impose regulations on the use of models whose body mass
index is below 18.5.
attributes.background:
This petition is to introduce a law prohibiting the use of models whose BMI is below 18.5 (the lowest healthy BMI considered by medical professionals). 
This requirement would necessitate a medical certificate from a
physician, to ensure the model is in good health.
attributes.additional_details:
This applies to models used in advertising, media, fashion shows,
catwalk shows and for any other other promotional purposes, and
applies to both male and female models.

The purpose of this requirement is to prohibit the normalisation of
low body weights and the glamorisation of an unhealthy body image.
Instead, using models with a healthy BMI of 18.5 or above would
re-calibrate the public perception of a ‘normal’ body shape and weight.

attributes.action: Restore Capital Punishment for terror offences.
attributes.background: With the increase in terrorist attacks and the threat of terrorism our country faces, it is time for the Government to restore Capital Punishment for those convicted of terror offences. Especially those who go on to cause injury or murder British citizens.

attributes.action: Don't close Parliamentary Petition system in the months surrounding an election
attributes.background:
Before and during the 2017 general election the Parliamentary Petition site closed. It was not reinstated until September, resulting in four months when citizens were denied a mechanism for raising concerns.

There is no reason why the mechanism for submitting or signing petitions should be closed
attributes.additional_details: Separate the running of the petitions site from the reviewing of petitions. The first should be available to citizens at all times (with the possible exception of during the actual election campaign), the second is reasonably the role of the petitions committee.

attributes.action: Abolish the role of the Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough
attributes.background:
We the people of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough simply wish for the role of Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough to be abolished.

The hard working tax-payers of the above said, do not wish to fund a Mayor and a Mayors office in all its entirety...

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Nitrogen Dioxide exposure by expanding the UKs sensor network
attributes.background: Levels of Nitrogen Dioxide across the UK are constantly over WHO limits, causing detrimental damage to our health. Awareness of high pollution areas is still low as the monitoring set up covers very few locations so people cannot take informed decisions to reduce their exposure.
attributes.additional_details: Exposure to any amount of nitrogen dioxide impacts our health and  our children's health.  Despite this there is limited coverage of the exposure we face in our daily lives.  There are few monitors and no public information showing pollution across our transport network, in schools, offices and levels inside vehicles. We therefore call upon the government to increase awareness of NO2 exposure by funding additional sensors and research into hotspots so information is available to the public.

attributes.action: End fines for parents who take their children on short holiday during term time.
attributes.background:
Since 2013 parents can be subject to criminal proceedings for taking their children on holiday during term times.

The current system exploits the law that was passed under the guise of dealing with repeated truancy. It is also indirectly discriminating against families based on class and income.
attributes.additional_details:
Two scientists (Dr. Beccy Smith and Alan Barr) have investigated the figures, separating the data for authorised term-time holidays from the broader dataset used by the government, which includes other absences such as those related to illness or exclusion.

They have concluded, independently, that authorised holiday absences are not linked to poorer attainment at KS2, and there is growing evidence to suggest this is the case across the stages.

attributes.action: Abolish tuition fees
attributes.background: Charging students for a near-essential requirement for future employment is discouraging even the best and brightest students from furthering their education and achieving their full potential, leaving students in £36,000+ of debt before even starting work. Education is a right, not a privilege.
attributes.additional_details: With more people attending university than ever before and it becoming more and more necessary in order to succeed in the world of work, our young people are being left saddled by huge financial burdens that can often lead to anxiety among students. In modern Britain education should be a right and not just a privilege for those who can afford it. Even with measures which attempt to relieve this burden, the problems created by this debt can only be resolved in one way: abolishing them entirely.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attacks
attributes.background: The effects of vitriolage on a victim are lifelong, therefore a life sentence is the only fair way to deal with the perpetrator. Mandatory life sentences would also act as a deterrent, and reduce the number of such heinous attacks in London.

attributes.action: Bring back the nit nurse!
attributes.background: Its just been the summer holidays and some children have returned to school with head lice. Children as young as 4 and 5 are riddled with them. That cannot be comfortable in the slightest! If we brought back the nit nurse then i think it would benefit alot of kids and destroy the nasty critters!

attributes.action: Ban prostitute review sites
attributes.background: There are sites where men review sex workers and their services. These sites are also a forum for online bullying, where they share personal details such as the real names of girls and their addresses, and nasty comments are all shared publicly for the world to see.

attributes.action: Install safe and fit for purpose safety fences (crash barriers) on UK motorways.
attributes.background: Having served as a Motorway Patrol Police Officer with the Central Motorway Police Group from 1993 to 2001 I attended the scene of many Motorway Cross-Over Road Traffic Collisions resulting in multiple loss of life. The current design it breached too easily and is not fit for purpose. Change them.
attributes.additional_details: There has been and continues to be multiple media reports on this subject year in and year out.... The current centre reservation crash barrier design (safety fence) is not working and many lives are being lost as a result of this failure. I am one of many former police officers and current police officers who are alarmed and the inadequacy of the current design. Time to act now and protect people from this in my opinion far too often preventable carnage.

attributes.action: Put tuition fees back to £3000 per year
attributes.background: The cost of university tuition is ridiculous. Along with the scrapping of the maintenance grant, students can expect to be saddled with up to £50000 debt. £3000 per year can ensure that universities maintain high standards whilst students don't have to break the bank (as much).
attributes.additional_details: The government claims that this is no problem as there are loans, yet it is obvious with this year's decreasing number of people going to university that no one sees the benefit. Students can no longer afford a fun night out: they must work to top up their maintenance loan, and although the standard of tuition may have risen due to concern on whether it is value for money, the cost is putting the most disadvantaged off going as they can't face having all the debt.

attributes.action: Tighter Regulations On Dog Breeding and Make Neutering and Spaying Compulsory
attributes.background: The country is awash with animals being dumped and abandoned, shelters are bursting at the seams. Healthy animals are being euthanised as there simply aren't enough homes available. Bitches are being bred repeatedly for financial gain. So called designer breeds were previously mongrels.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the rules states 2 KC registered litters per bitch, this can be overcome by registering extra females in a litter and using the extra papers on the original bitch.

There is no law regulating unscrupulous breeding.

1. Licence breeders, limiting the amount of breeding bitches per breeder, inspect regularly to maintain welfare and standards.
2. Spaying and neutering should be compulsory. Stop puppy farms and back yard breeders.
3. Tougher penalties for people in breach of the law.

attributes.action: Stop car Insurance Companies from increasing drivers for no fault accident claim
attributes.background: Make applying financial increases to driver insurance premiums who have been involved in an accident with a non-insured driver or in a no fault accident, illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unreasonable and unjust that drivers whom are unfortunate in being involved in a no fault accidents, or those involved in incidents whereby the other driver is not insured; should suffer a financial increase on their own insurance premiums. 

We pay a huge amount of money to the Insurance sector to protect us against incidents where our vehicles are stolen or damaged. At the moment a no fault accident will attract a minimum of a 10.81% load on your premiums, how is this fair or just?

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Suspend the ambassador of Myanmar for his country's action against the Rohingya.
attributes.background: Awful reports are coming out of Myanmar about atrocities against the Rohingya muslim minority. The government of Myanmar refuses to help as they deny that the Rohingya are citizens of their country.
attributes.additional_details: There are several BBC articles explaining the situation, which you can find on their website.

attributes.action: Make safe standing zones a legal requirement for English Football league clubs.
attributes.background: To prevent clubs from forcing passionate season ticket holders to remain seated during matches, and to promote a positive atmosphere for supporters.

attributes.action: Make dentistry free at the point of delivery for all and fees payable later
attributes.background: The NHS dental services in England are a shambles. There is no free at the point of delivery service for patients in need of treatment who don't fall into the low earnings category. I am petitioning to make all UK NHS dentistry free at point of delivery giving everyone a chance to access it.
attributes.additional_details:
Payment would then be made at a later date. It would mean no one would have to suffer. We don't fall into the low income bracket but we also cannot afford dentistry on the spot. My practice doesn't even do emergency slots. I'm sat here with a hole in one of my molars, the pain of the exposed nerve is worse than childbirth yet there's no way I'll be able to get treatment within the next month.
The whole point of paying national insurance and tax is to guarantee our healthcare!

attributes.action: Bus passes for Over Sixties in England
attributes.background: We as women aged 60 are not allowed a concession bus pass in England . But they have bus passes in London Wales and Scotland , why should we be discriminated. It would also ease our financial burden as we are denied our state pension .

attributes.action: Police required by law to pursue suspects not wearing a helmet
attributes.background: Every day there is more and more crime on motorbikes/mopeds etc. If the people riding them aren’t wearing a helmet, they know that the police cannot pursue them. They are laughing and getting away with it. Enough is enough. If they're big enough to do the crime, they're big enough to take the risk.

attributes.action: Create a Devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: Scotland has the Scottish Parliament, Wales has the Welsh Assembly (soon to be Parliament) and Northern Ireland has the Northern Ireland Assembly. As the most populous country within the United Kingdom, England should also have a parliament to end the West Lothian Question.
attributes.additional_details: For too long England has had Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Irish MPs vote on matters that only affect England. It is time to have a devolved parliament to bring fairness and democracy to the region.

attributes.action: To make the wearing of a cycle helmet compulsory when cycling on public roads.
attributes.background: The increase and popularity of cycling has exploded over the past few years and brought thousands of cyclists onto our crowded roads and into conflict with other road users. The potential for accidents has increased and the potential for fatal head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015, 18,844 cyclists were injured in reported road accidents, including 3,339 who were killed or seriously injured. (Source ROSPA)

attributes.action:
Impose legal regulations on the use of digitally altered images
in the media.
attributes.background:
This use of digitally altered images of persons in all broadcast & non-broadcast media should be more heavily regulated.

The only alterations to be permissible under law are elements that are temporary in nature (for example a blemish/bruise etc) and such alterations should be disclosed.
attributes.additional_details:
Any alterations that modify the size and proportion of a model should be prohibited.

This is to ensure that a model's physical appearance is not artificially manipulated, including their weight, shape and size. 

If such acts are carried out, the offending party should be awarded
with a large fine.

Photoshop should be used in a sophisticated manner, and images promoted to the public should encourage a realistic and healthy body image.

attributes.action: Make recycling of all household low-grade plastics mandatory throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Household non-bottle low-grade plastics, including plastic pots, tubs and trays, are collected for recycling at the roadside in very few UK areas. It therefore goes to landfill. I call on the Government to introduce legislation ultimately leading to the mandatory recycling of all low-grade plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Global plastic use is out of control. We need urgently to reduce plastic waste and mitigate its devastating impact on the environment. A good place to start, and to set an example, is ensuring all household plastic is recycled in the UK. Recycling of plastic pots, tubs and trays (except for black plastic) was successfully introduced by Cornwall Council recently. In other UK areas, this plastic ends up in the general waste bin for landfill. We need to recycle all household plastic across the UK.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Now that the consequences of leaving the EU  are  more widely appreciated it is essential that a second vote is held so that people can make an informed decision about whether they want to remain part of Europe or not.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that leaving the European union would be an economic, political and social disaster.
